resources.string: Asian-Canadian Special Events Association (ACSEA) is committed to protecting the privacy and security of personal information held about its patrons. Our purpose is to assure anyone who does business with us that ACSEA complies with the Privacy Act, the Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act, and Canada’s Anti-Spam Legislation.

The following is a statement of our commitment to ensure that the collection, use, disclosure and security of your personal information complies with the provisions of the Privacy Act, the Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act, and Canada’s Anti-Spam Legislation, in terms of legal conformity and ethical practice.

ACSEA only collects personal information from: Attendees (directly or through the venue box offices and partnering ticket agencies) Donors Members Volunteers Others who have shown an interest in ACSEA This information is collected by a variety of methods: phone, fax, mail, email, online, or in person.

ACSEA uses personal information to better serve our patrons and to expand our community of support. This primarily includes using the information: To deliver services to provide information about tickets, events, membership and donations To thank supporters, fulfill subscriber and donor benefits To invite supporters to special events To sell tickets and solicit donations For service phone calls and e-mails ACSEA is committed to using personal information in a respectful and useful way. ACSEA is also committed to making sure patrons do not receive more than a reasonable number of emails, letters or phone calls.

ACSEA treats its obligations with respect to the use and disclosure of personal information very seriously. Generally, we will only use or disclose personal information for the primary purpose that it was collected or for a purpose related to the primary purpose that you would reasonably expect it to be used. The ACSEA will not sell, rent or share your personal information.

Personal information is stored in our database(s) on a secure server and in hard copy files. Only authorized ACSEA personnel have access to this information. ACSEA uses personal information to better serve our patrons and to expand our community of support.

ACSEA does its best to ensure that all information is recorded accurately—if you notice any errors in our correspondence with you or if your personal information changes, please contact us at info@acsea.ca to update your file. If you do not wish to be contacted by phone, mail or email, please contact us and we will ensure that your request is honoured. If you have any questions about ACSEA’s privacy policy or concerns about the way that your information is being used, please contact us at info@acsea.ca.

Survival for many is an act of courage; to live is to find meanings in the suffering. When people are displaced and lives are detoured, the tenacity one demonstrates to survive is the essence of beauty. 
 
 Painters, musicians, poets and artists love to capture this quality in people and these works often inspire others to find the strength to continue their path. 
 

Wars often show the worst in mankind as violence is the most convenient way for the power to be gained. Like many places in Asia, Vietnam and Taiwan shared chapters of histories resisting the intruders and living under the colonizers. Time and time again, the people rise to savour their families, cultures and homeland; stories of remarkable women keeping families together resemble the vary tenacity required in survival. 
 

What is courage really like? When does survival become art?

Thank you for using https://www.acsea.ca/ (our “Site”). By visiting our site or using any associated app and user interfaces, you indicate your acknowledgment and acceptance of the Terms and Conditions and Privacy Policy. If you do not agree or cannot comply with these terms and conditions, then you may not use this site or any associated app and user interfaces.
 
 TERM TERMINATION 
 These terms and conditions are applicable to you upon your accessing the site and/or completing the registration process through the site and/or the ACSEA app. These terms and conditions, or any part of them, may be terminated by Asian-Canadian Special Events Association without notice at any time, for any reason. The provisions relating to Copyrights, Trademarks, Participation Disclaimer, and Indemnification shall survive any termination.
 
 COPYRIGHTS 
 The content included in any ACSEA site and/or associated app, including but not limited to text, graphics or code is copyrighted as a collective work under the Canadian copyright laws, and is the property of the Asian-Canadian Special Events Association, identified by the name or logo on materials posted, is identified as being the copyright owner. If another party is noted as a copyright holder, please contact that party for permission to use the materials in question. 
 
 THE ASIAN-CANADIAN SPECIAL EVENTS ASSOCIATION (ACSEA) EVENT TERMS AND CONDITIONS 
 Events may consist of festivals, concerts or other forms of advertised events whether attendance is free or if an admission fee is charged to attend. Your name and contact information collected during the registration process may be shared with event participants and the speakers in the form of a delegate list. By registering for the event you are consenting to the use and disclosure of the information for this purpose. Registration information will not be shared with event exhibitors, sponsors and other conference delegates. ACSEA reserves the right to cancel events at any time prior to the scheduled date; in this case, our liability is limited to a full refund of the session fee. Confirmation of registration to any specific event will be sent by email before the event or workshop. Payment is due upon registration. Registrants who do not show up for the event in question are not eligible for a refund. Cancellations received by our offices by mail/email within the specified cancellation date are refundable and may be subject to an administration fee. Refunds will not be given after that date, however, delegate substitution is permitted. For the duration of ACSEA events, all volunteers and community groups that are on festival grounds must consent to the use and possible distribution of their own photo. ACSEA will not sell, trade or provide any information from the ACSEA database, including personal information to companies, solicitors or other third parties for any reason. These photos will be used solely for promotional purposes for the festival. 
 
 USE OF SITE 
 Harassment in any manner or form on the site, including via e-mail, chat, or by use of obscene or abusive language, is strictly forbidden. Impersonation of others, including Asian-Canadian Special Events Association employees, host, or representative, as well as other members or visitors on the site is prohibited. You may not upload to, distribute, or otherwise publish through the site any content which is libellous, defamatory, obscene, threatening, invasive of privacy or publicity rights, abusive, illegal, or otherwise objectionable which may constitute or encourage a criminal offense, violate the rights of any party or which may otherwise give rise to liability or violate any law. You may not upload commercial content on the site or use the site to solicit others to join or become members of any other commercial online service or other organization. The Asian-Canadian Special Events Association reserves the right to block or remove communications or materials that it determines to be (a) abusive, defamatory, or obscene, (b) fraudulent, deceptive, or misleading, (c) in violation of a copyright, trademark or; other intellectual property right of another or (d) offensive or otherwise unacceptable to the Asian-Canadian Special Events Association at its sole discretion.
 
 INDEMNIFICATION You agree to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Asian-Canadian Special Events Association, its officers, directors, employees, and suppliers (collectively the “Service Providers”) from and against all losses, expenses, damages and costs, including reasonable attorneys’ fees, resulting from any violation of these terms and conditions or any activity related to your account (including negligent or wrongful conduct) by you or any other person accessing our site using your internet account.
 
 THIRD PARTY LINKS 
 In an attempt to provide increased value to our visitors, Asian-Canadian Special Events Association may link to sites operated by third parties. However, even if the third party is an affiliate, the Asian-Canadian Special Events Association has no control over these linked sites, all of which have separate privacy and data collection practices, independent of the Asian-Canadian Special Events Association. These linked sites are only for your convenience and therefore you access them at your own risk. Nonetheless, the Asian-Canadian Special Events Association seeks to protect the integrity of its web site, app and the links placed upon it and therefore requests any feedback on not only its own site and app but for sites it links to as well (including if a specific link does not work).
